# Java 17 Migration Summary

This document describes the changes made to migrate the javametrics project from Java 8 to Java 17.

## Changes Made

### 1. Updated Maven Compiler Plugin (All modules)
- Updated `maven-compiler-plugin` from version `3.6.1` to `3.11.0`
- Changed source and target from `1.8` to `17`
- Added `<release>17</release>` for better Java version compatibility
- Affected files:
  - javaagent/pom.xml
  - dashboard/pom.xml
  - prometheus/pom.xml
  - rest/pom.xml
  - spring/pom.xml
  - codewind/pom.xml
  - codewind-spring/pom.xml

### 2. Updated Maven Javadoc Plugin (All modules)
- Updated `maven-javadoc-plugin` from version `2.9.1` to `3.5.0`
- Removed deprecated `<additionalparam>` configuration
- Added `<source>17</source>` configuration
- Affected files:
  - javaagent/pom.xml
  - dashboard/pom.xml
  - prometheus/pom.xml
  - rest/pom.xml
  - spring/pom.xml
  - codewind/pom.xml
  - codewind-spring/pom.xml

### 3. Updated JaCoCo Maven Plugin
- Updated `jacoco-maven-plugin` from version `0.8.4` to `0.8.11`
- This was necessary to support Java 17 bytecode (class file major version 61)
- Affected files:
  - javaagent/pom.xml
  - dashboard/pom.xml
  - prometheus/pom.xml
  - rest/pom.xml
  - codewind/pom.xml

### 4. Updated ASM Library
- Updated `org.objectweb.asm:asm` and `org.objectweb.asm:asm-commons` from version `5.0.4` to `9.7`
- ASM 5 does not support Java 17 bytecode
- Affected files:
  - javaagent/pom.xml

### 5. Updated ASM API Version in Source Code
- Changed ASM API version from `ASM5` to `ASM9` in source files
- Affected files:
  - javaagent/src/main/java/com/ibm/javametrics/instrument/BaseAdviceAdapter.java
  - javaagent/src/main/java/com/ibm/javametrics/instrument/ClassAdapter.java

## Verification

The project was successfully built and verified with Java 17:
```bash
mvn clean verify
```

Build result: SUCCESS

```bash
javap -v target/classes/com/ibm/javametrics/Javametrics.class | grep "major version"
# Output: major version: 61
```

## Compiler Warnings

The following deprecation warnings are present but do not affect the build:
- Use of deprecated `newInstance()` method in `Agent.java`
- Use of deprecated servlet API methods in test code
- Use of deprecated `WebMvcConfigurerAdapter` in Spring module
- Use of deprecated `finalize()` method in codewind module
- Raw types usage in codewind-spring module

These warnings are informational and do not prevent successful compilation or execution.
EOF
